scd.caption: Longman Student CD-ROM for the TOEFL® Test: Next Generation iBT

styles.button: button {border-bottom:1px solid gray;border-right:1px solid gray;border-top:1px solid white;border-left:1px solid white;background-color:white;width:58px;height:46px;}

menu.title: Skills - Independent Tasks - Free Choice Tasks
Skills - Independent Tasks - Paired Choice Tasks
Skills - Integrated Tasks (Reading and Listening) - Campus Tasks
Skills - Integrated Tasks (Reading and Listening) - Academic Tasks

skills.read: <1>Understand vocabulary from context (Vocabulary| and Reference)</1> <2>Recognize referents (Vocabulary and Reference)</2> <3>Simplify meanings of sentences (Sentences)</3> <4>Insert sentences into a passage (Sentences)</4> <5>Find factual information (Details)</5> <6>Understand negative facts (Details)</6> <7>Make inferences from stated facts (Inferences)</7> <8>Infer rhetorical purpose (Inferences)</8> <9>Select summary information (Reading to learn)</9> <10>Complete schematic tables (Reading to learn)</10>
skills.listen: <1>Understand the gist (Basic Comprehension)</1> <2>Understand the details (Basic Comprehension)</2> <3>Understand the function (Pragmatic Understanding)</3> <4>Understand the speaker's stance (Pragmatic| Understanding)</4> <5>Understand the organization (Connecting| Information)</5> <6>Understand relationships (Connecting Information)</6>
skills.write: <1>Note the main points as you read (Integrated Task)</1> <2>Note the main points as you listen (Integrated| Task)</2> <3>Plan before you write (Integrated Task)</3> <4>Write a topic statement (Integrated Task)</4> <5>Write unified supporting paragraphs (Integrated| Task)</5> <6>Review sentence structure (Integrated Task)</6> <7>Review grammar (Integrated Task)</7> <8>Plan before you write (Independent Task)</8> <9>Write the introduction (Independent Task)</9> <10>Write unified supporting paragraphs (Independent| Task)</10> <11>Connect the supporting paragraphs (Independent| Task)</11> <12>Write the conclusion (Independent Task)</12> <13>Review sentence structure (Independent Task)</13> <14>Review grammar (Independent Task)</14>
skills.speak: <1>Plan the free choice response (Independent Tasks)</1> <2>Make the free choice response (Independent Tasks)</2> <3>Plan the paired choice response (Independent| Tasks)</3> <4>Make the paired choice response (Independent| Tasks)</4> <5>Note the main points as you read (Integrated| Tasks - Reading and Listening)</5> <6>Note the main points as you listen (Integrated| Tasks - Reading and Listening)</6> <7>Plan the response (Integrated Tasks - Reading| and Listening)</7> <8>Make the response (Integrated Tasks - Reading| and Listening)</8> <9>Note the main points as you read (Integrated| Tasks - Reading and Listening)</9> <10>Note the main points as you listen (Integrated| Tasks - Reading and Listening)</10> <11>Plan the response (Integrated Tasks - Reading| and Listening)</11> <12>Make the response (Integrated Tasks - Reading| and Listening)</12> <13>Note the main points as you listen (Integrated| Tasks - Listening)</13> <14>Plan the response (Integrated Tasks - Listening)</14> <15>Make the response (Integrated Tasks - Listening)</15> <16>Note the main points as you listen (Integrated| Tasks - Listening)</16> <17>Plan the response (Integrated Tasks - Listening)</17> <18>Make the response (Integrated Tasks - Listening)</18>
skills.speak.x: <1-2>Independent - Free Choice Task</1-2> <3-4>Independent - Paired Choice Task</3-4> <5-8>Integrated - Reading and Listening - Campus| Task</5-8> <9-12>Integrated - Reading and Listening - Academic| Task</9-12> <13-15>Integrated - Listening - Campus Task</13-15> <16-18>Integrated - Listening - Academic Task</16-18>

text.quit.confirm: Are you sure you want to quit the application?
text.exit.confirm: If you leave now, your results for this section will not be saved.|Are you sure you want to leave this section?
text.exit.prep.confirm: Are you sure you want to quit this section and return to the menu?
text.exit.end.confirm: Are you sure you want to leave this section?
text.exit.overview.confirm: Are you sure you want to quit the Overview?
text.exit.score.confirm: Are you sure you want to leave this section?
text.exit.review.confirm: Are you sure you want to leave this section and return to the menu?
text.exit.speak.confirm: Your recording will not be saved when you leave this section.|To save your recording, click Save Recording on the Checklist screen.|Do you need to save your recording?
text.signon.new: Starting as a new user erases existing scores.|Do you want to proceed?
text.signon.disk: Uploading scores replaces existing scores.|Do you want to proceed?
text.signon.local.error: The program score file is corrupted.|Please try again as New User or Disk User.
text.signon.disk.error: The selected score file is invalid.|Please try again.
text.signoff.export: You must save your data to preserve it for future sessions. Do you want to save your score data to a file?
text.scores.save.error: Writing score file failed! Please reinstall the application.
text.scores.export.error: Writing score file failed! Please try again.
text.test.checklist: You must click in the Yes or No column of each Checklist statement before you can continue.
text.speak.replace: File $1 already exists. do you want to replace it?
text.speak.save.error: Saving recording file failed! Please try again.
text.speak.notrecorded: You did not record your response.
text.speak.notfound.2: Recording file $1 is missing.|Do you want to locate the file?
text.read.mark: Paragraph $1 is marked with an arrow ($2).
text.read.passage: Read the whole passage before you begin to answer the question.|However you will be able to see the passage again with the question.
text.read.insert.1: Look at the four squares [$1] that indicate where the following sentence can be added to the passage.
text.read.insert.2: Where would the sentence best fit?

read.end.1.s.b: You have seen all of the questions in this part of the Reading section.||Click on Return to keep working.|Click on Continue to go on.

read.end.1.m.b: You have seen all of the questions in this part of the Reading section.|You have time left to Review. As long as there is time remaining,|you can check your work.||Click on Return to keep working.|Click on Continue to go on.

read.end.1.t.a.b: You have seen all of the questions in this part of the Reading section.|You have time left to Review. As long as there is time remaining,|you can check your work.||Click on Return to keep working.|Click on Continue to go on to the next part of the test.

read.end.1.t.b.b: You have seen all of the questions in this part of the Reading section.|You have time left to Review. As long as there is time remaining,|you can check your work.||Click on Return to keep working.|Click on Continue to go on.

read.end.2.b: Once you leave this part of the Reading section, you WILL NOT|be able to return to it.

text.guide.next: When you are ready to go on to the questions,|click on Next.
text.guide.multichoice: Click on the correct answer. To make a|change, click on a different answer.
text.guide.insert: Click on a square [$1] to add the sentence to the passage.
text.guide.select.1: Drag your answer choices to the spaces where they belong. To remove an answer choice, click on it.|To review the passage, click on View Text.
text.guide.select.2: Drag your answer choices to the spaces where they belong. To remove an answer choice, click on it.|To review the passage, click on View Text.
text.explain.check.2: Click on each check mark to see an explanation.
text.explain.select.1: Click on each answer choice to see an explanation.
text.explain.select.2: Click on each answer choice to see an explanation.
text.explain.select.errors: Click on each error for its explanation.
text.write.0: Read the passage. On a piece of paper, take notes on the main points of the reading passage. When you finish your notes, click on Next to see sample notes.
text.write.1: Read the sample notes and compare them to your notes. Click on Next when you are ready to continue.
text.write.4: You may listen to the passage again. When you finish your notes, click on Next to see sample notes.
text.write.5: Compare these sample notes to your notes. Click on Next when you are ready to continue.
text.write.6: Read the sample answer to the question. You may review the sample notes and listen to the lecture again. Click on Next to answer questions.
text.write.10: Read the question. On a piece of paper, take notes on the main points of a response. When you finish your notes, click on Next to see sample notes.
text.write.11.question: Read the question. You may review the Sample Notes. Click on Next when you are ready to read a sample answer.
text.write.11.notes: Read these sample notes. Click on Next when you are ready to read a sample answer.
text.write.12.question: Read the sample answer. Click on Next when you are ready to answer questions.
text.write.12.notes: Read the sample notes and sample answer. Click on Next when you are ready to answer questions.
text.write.20: Read the passage. On a piece of paper, take notes on the main points of the reading passage.
text.write.28: You have 20 minutes to plan and write your response. Your response will be judged on the basis of the quality of your writing and on how well your response presents the points in the lecture and their relationship to the reading passage. Typically, an effective response will be 150 to 225 words.
text.write.30: Read each statement and click in the Yes or No column. Click on the Study Tools to review the passages and see samples.
text.write.30.checklist: Read each statement and click in the Yes or No column. Click on the Study Tools to review the passages and see samples.
text.write.30.checklist.review: Click on the Study Tools to review the passages and see samples.
text.write.30.notes: Compare these sample notes to your notes.
text.write.30.sample: Compare this sample answer to your response.
text.write.34: Read the question below. You have 30 minutes to plan, write, and revise your essay. Typically, an effective response will contain a minimum of 300 words.
text.write.36: Read each statement and click in the Yes or No column. Click on the Study Tools to review the question and see samples.
text.write.36.checklist: Read each statement and click in the Yes or No column. Click on the Study Tools to review the question and see samples.
text.write.36.checklist.review: Click on the Study Tools to review the question and see samples.
text.write.36.question: Read the question.
text.write.36.notes: Compare these sample notes to your notes.
text.write.36.sample: Compare this sample answer to your response.
text.listen.multichoice: You must enter an answer before you can leave|this question.
text.listen.check.1: You must select the EXACT number of choices|before you can leave this question. Refer to the|directions.
text.listen.check.2: You must select the EXACT number of choices|before you can leave this question. Refer to the|directions.
text.review: Below is a list of questions in this section. The Status column shows if a question has been answered, not answered, or not yet seen. The question you were looking at last is highlighted when you enter Review.||To review a specific question from the list, click on the question to highlight it, then click on Go to Question at the top of the screen. When there are more questions than will fit on the screen, you can use the scroll bar to view the others.||To leave Review and return to where you were in the test, click on Return.
text.score.sections: Double-click on a Section or Test to review it.
text.score.attempts: Double-click on an Attempt to review it.
text.score.questions: Double-click on a question to review it.
text.score.skills: This report shows how well you are doing overall in each of the $1 skills.
